Reviews.Title: “value for the price”
Reviews.Author: bernaldine
Reviews.Content: Small king bed room with old towels (1 of each) had to ask houskeeping for a second set but they were very friendly and complyed. Room had a GREAT VIEW of a WALL At 35.00 we really didn't expect the Hilton. I must say that the complementry breakfast was quite nice , just no fruit

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one!”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: Where to start. Reservations booked but when we arrived at check in time a 20 minute wait turned into two hours. Older motel but no excuse for what looks like hand me down furniture. Small room but furnishing allowed no movement when seated at desk. End table lamp on one side failed to work. Only one set of linen and promise to provide another set never happened. We paid $100 with a discount but advertised WiFi down and promises to restore never happened. Room lacked microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, and all the liitle things that make traveling enjoyable. We inadverntly left a personal pillow but after leaving and calling from Benson AZ about recovering the pillow, front desk was of no help. Will never stay at this one again and have a biased eye to ever booking arrangements with the Days Inn chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth paying more then $50 a night.”
Reviews.Author: sscott24
Reviews.Content: when booking my room online it said there was.an alarm clock and coffee maker in room and there was not also there was no iron or iron bored. When I checked in I had to change rooms cuz the first was dirty like the maids only made the beds. If you want ice u have to pay for it. they dont provide hand towels or wash clothes. Hot.water stays hot for about five mins. unless you book online and get a good deal there rates are supper high for what the room comes with.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: chocolateGrants_Nm
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located. Walking distance to Metrocenter Mall, restaurants, movie theatre, spas. Close to downtown Phoenix, SkyHarbor airport with complimentary shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler with Dog”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWithDog
Reviews.Content: Got this room for $30 on special. 50% off and would have been very upset if I had paid full price. Back of the hotel, bedspread did not even come down and cover the box spring, furniture well used with burn holes. Two bath towels, one face towel, and no wash cloths for a double room. Days Inn used to stand for a fairly decent quality, but not any more. Sheets felt they had been bleached and dried and were uncomfortable and scratchy. Walked on the carpet only with socks on.Had to call the front desk to see how to get on the internet. It was fairly ok. $10 fee for the dog. Should have stayed in a Motel 6. Like the Days Inn in Needles, CA I would not stay here again. the breakfast room was fine, but with one waffle maker and one toaster the crowd had to wait. I grabbed a muffin and left. No area to walk the dog that was decent and I sure would not wander the area alone at night. The pool was decent and even had some shade tents set up. There is a bar and grill close by called Jimbos. Find it on a Thursday happy hour and you get LOTS of free wings with your drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: nbalsari
Reviews.Content: Even though the staff was kind and helpful, the room had a terrible smell that I did not notice in the beginning as i only droped my luggage and left. Once i was back, i even could not enter the room. I thougt that the problem was with that particular room first but after trying two more rooms with the similar smell problem, I asked for a refund and left the place. I do not know how the local authorities grand permission to this place. It may be regarded as a public health hazard.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Savannah S
Reviews.Content: OK, so I did not know what to expect from this area but I actually had a wonderful time! We spent most of our time in the hotel area. It was very clean, the rooms were nice with everything working. They had lots of fresh green grass that my dog would enjoy while our door was open. Breakfast was free each morning and even though I did not get the chance to swim, the pool was heated! The staff was so helpful and nice. They had great customer service here! I would for sure return to this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: Ryan P
Reviews.Content: I stayed because of a special this hotel offered which was a night stay including shuttle to and from airport with free parking for 2 weeks for 69.00. I had a early flight the next day.The property offered a free breakfast with a King sized bed in a newly renovated clean and quiet room. The shuttle was on-time and my car was safe in this good neighborhood. All staff were courteous and helpful. The location is convenient right off the I 17.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely stay here for my future visits”
Reviews.Author: Srikanth K
Reviews.Content: I got a deal for 29$ a day for a king size non-smoking room in this place through expedia deals. It was well worth it. Joe, the receptionist, was very friendly. They also offer free wireless access to the internet.The room was clean and tidy and they also provide a free complimentary breakfast between 6 am to 9 am. The room had a CRT television set with standard channels like HBO, espn, a local movie channel and a few more, although the quality of the picture for some were not great. But, i couldn't have asked more for what i paid.They also offer you a ride to and from the airport for 10$ (not sure if it is for each way or for the round trip). If you want to save few bucks there is a valley metro city bus stop less than 5 minutes from this place (the city is well connected through the bus and rail routes) with an all day pass of $3.5 ($5.25 if you get it in the bus) and 3 day pass of $10.5 with which you can ride the buses and trains as many times as you wish until the validity.

Reviews.Title: “i wouldn't go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Anna M
Reviews.Content: We were only suppose to be here for 2 weeks. we ran into issues that we were going to have to stay longer. the manager mark was so polite and understanding he helped us. we had to stay 2 days longer. the staff was extremely nice. grace and Joe who worked at the front desk. they were great to talk to. when i come to phoenix i will definately be staying here. i just want to say there is not one bad thing i can say about the staff. they have gone up and beyond the duties that they are assigned to. It is said that the day we left we were unable to say gooodbye to Mark, the manager.

Reviews.Title: “best inexpensive motel in the area by far”
Reviews.Author: niky885
Reviews.Content: although it was not directly off the freeway-a few turns off- this nicely kept property was surprising, one, because if was an inexpensive place to stay, but it was very well kept, the rooms exceeded our expectations, they were very clean and neat, and the front dest staff were very polite and nice, giving information as to accessing the morning coffee and danish provided and were it was. ive had stayed in most lodging within this area, and it beats them all hands down, also its access slightly off the freeway is a perk for less noise. you will be content with this choice, now i know where to stay from now on, when i stay in this area

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: rdtaz2
Reviews.Content: You definitely get what you pay for here. The TV is on the left side of the room and the bed is on the right side. How difficult would it be to put sheets on the bed that actually fit? The bottom sheet was a flat sheet that was meant for a queen size bed and we wrestled with it all night. 25 cents fill your ice bucket? What hotel charges for ice? Neighborhood not the nicest place. Don't leave the hotel after dark and definitely don't go for a sunset walk. Otherwise not to bad.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever, refused to stay!! And they refused to give us a refund for all three days that we DID NOT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: CheriseMenzie
Reviews.Content: This was the most disgusting place we have ever tried to stay at. There were a whole group of people trying to check in when we arrived and we were made to wait about an hour before the attendant got to us. She was frazzled and it was obvious that she could not handle her job. The room that we were givin was not what we had reserved. Not to mention we called in advance to check on our reservation the day before. The room that they put us in was in the back by the dumpsters and there were lots of "people" hanging out on the terrrace "partying". At this point it was after midnight and we were exhausted so insead of leaving we went back to the front desk to complain. She did not leave her "post'but she then offered us another room by the pool which was what we had reserved to begin with. (mind you it was not available10 minutes earier). When we got to this room it smelled so badly we could not even enter. At this point we went back to the front desk and asked for a refund. It has been six months and the days in has been horrible. They refuse to refund our money for the room that we did not say in and charged us for the entire three days we were suppose to spend there. We ended up staying at the Sheraton Crescent and the staff was amazing and it smelled great and it was not loud and out of control. The cost difference was about $100.00 but it was so worth it. This Days Inn was the worst I have ever seen. Do not believe the managenents responses to our comments. They lie to make you stay at their establishment. It really was bad!!!The bullet proof glass that the attendant stays behind is a good indicator on whether or not you want to bring your family here. The Sheraton that we stayed at was only4 minutes away and they had no need for bullet proof glass!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value For Your Money!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharpy102362
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay overnight, I had made reservations at this motel even though the star rating was not that great. I've come to the conclusion that the ratings made were by persons that needed to be at the Biltmore and not easy to please. This was a VERY NICE hotel!!! VERY CLEAN, NO BED BUGS, hot water in shower, TV, coffeemaker in room & microwave. We stayed from Sat to Sun, had towels, washcloths. On Sun, I wanted an to make another pot of coffee, and had no problems getting the extra coffee I wanted. The front desk clerk 'Linda" was extremely nice, and gave us no problem when I called and told her we were running late (due to a flat tire). The pool was clean and inviting. The continental breakfast had waffles, donuts, coffee, juice. Very nice. Would stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE...MOTEL 6 IN DISGUISE!! PLEASE READ”
Reviews.Author: pdau75
Reviews.Content: My wife and our 8 month old stayed at this dump in July of 2011 and were terribly disappointed. For starters, this MOTEL was a Motel 6 until recently when the owner decided to spend more money on the Days Inn sign versus renovating the place. -The "free" WiFi is more than deceiving in that the routers are in each room in a metal box locked (i.e. you will be lucky to get 2 bars). -The locking mechanisms on the doors are old and in most cases broken. Our key malfunctioned several times. This is a problem when you are standing in the 110 degree Phoenix heat. -This dump charges 25 cents for a bucket of ice. What hotels charge for ice? Answer: motels that you rent by the hour. -Lastly and for us the final straw. The carpets were dyed in the "renovation". We had over $300 worth of clothing damaged as a result of the dye bleeding onto our clothing. The owner agreed to refund our stay, but refused to reimburse us for our damaged clothing. He then tried to blackmail me into accepting the refund as "hush" money, but the inept guy did not realize that we were already refunded. As this is a Days Inn (technically) it falls under the Wyndham umbrella. I called Wyndham to voice concern about this property and the owner, but they were not very concerned though I am...er...was a Wyndham Rewards member. ***STAY AWAY*** ***STAY AWAY*** ***STAY AWAY***

Reviews.Title: “this place support domestic voilence and druggies”
Reviews.Author: steveggflagstaff_AZ
Reviews.Content: I was there on July 31 and my family witnesses a lady get punched, slapped and drug into her room while we were at the pool. We tried calling 911 but did not have the address. Several other guests tried calling the office for the address and Linda the front desk lady refused to give us the address and said she would handle it. I had to look up the address on my phone then call 911 by that time all parties of the abuse where gone thanks to the front desk Linda who called them and told them a guest had called 911. When the police did arrive she did not even give them the license plate number. After speaking with the manager Mark, he claims he called 911 and left the property. Mark refuses to give me the owners name, he claimed it was owned by the cooperate which I just got off the phone with them so I know that was not true. I guess I now know where the employees get it.

Reviews.Title: “HOT ROOM...BAD AREA!”
Reviews.Author: caleggs_0423
Reviews.Content: My husband started a new job nearby so he booked an entire week at this motel while we were in transition. I stayed with him the first 3 days while house hunting. We have several complaints. Our room was so hot. They checked the AC for us but said it was working correctly. We had it on high, which was so noisy we couldn't sleep, but even on high, it never cooled to comfortable temperature. As soon as it would "kick" on and we'd feel some cool air, it would kick right off again. We were constantly sweating! They did offer a different room, but really didn't want to have to pack up again and move so we stuck it out. The pool was disgusting...and this was before the dust storm!! Murky & dirty. The maid service was terrible...each morning the bedspread was just thrown back on the bed...we had to ask for a packet of coffee all but one morning and also had to ask for extra towel each day....one day we only got one hand towel! There are no microwaves or fridges so we had an ice chest w/ some water, fruit, etc..but you had to pay a quarter for a small bucket of ice. Oh, and there was a lot of rif raf using foul language hanging out at the pool & drinking alcohol...with their kids....and police officers were often in the lobby looking for people. My husband has to stay one more week in a motel, but he is moving to a different one next week.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was great and Im booking up for next year”
Reviews.Author: geetrosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed hear drom the 13th May till the 17th 2011. The rooms where clean and adiquate for our needs, We came to phoenix to play golf, and being both disables and OAPs the staff looked after both of us like royalty, nothing was to much trouble, Well done Linda (manager) and her team

Reviews.Title: “Ice for a fee”
Reviews.Author: smile100h
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight to catch, so this hotel was a good location to stay a night. Check-in was quick. The room was clean. Everything is in order. Only two things surprised us. One is the "energy surcharge". I don't know how this comes from. The other is you have to pay a quarter to get a bucket of ice which is the first to me when staying at a hotel. Business people are trying so hard to make money nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, over all great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tomnmary1982
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i travel quite often and whenever we come to phoenix we always stay here. NEVER have we ever experienced any of what was mentioned in the last review by wesley hall. As a matter a fact, my girlfriend and i believe we were checking in right behind mr. hall. it was late, probably around 12:30 or so and kim, the night attendant had just finished checking in a group of rooms for what I believe, from my understanding, was a youth basketball team. by youth I mean 17, 18, 19 year olds or so, whom by the way, were also accompanied by coaches and other adults which i am assuming were parents. As i recall, mr hall was shortly after them but before us and he was completely rude to the night attendant. he ended up getting his keys, leaving disgruntled and going to his room. to my surprise, the room we got was very close to his on the south side of the building. i am not sure what mr hall means by people outside or what not because when we pulled into our parking space and moved our stuff into our room, i did not see anyone outside at all. we unloaded our car and went in the room and fell asleep very quickly as it was very quiet. we also were not disturbed by any other guests at all! in the morning we woke up, went to breakfast, which by the way mirna does a wonderful job on and the waffles are amazing! we only stayed one night this particular stay but have stayed up to one week on other occasions. never on any of our stays have we had any problems with any of the staff here or manager. i definately would recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget and looking for a good, relaxing, cheep and safe place to stay! keep up the great work guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: tristan64
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 3/31/11 to 4/5/11. Staff was great and very helpful with anything we requested. Room was very clean and had everything we needed.. Breakfasts were great. We definitely will stay there any time we travel to Phoenix. Thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Restuarants and Downtown”
Reviews.Author: odaat2001
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this location for the last year and a half and have never had a missed reservation or any problems at check in. The rooms were remodeled about a year ago and still look as if it was done yesterday. Linda, Barb, Tim and Cathy always remember my name and even recognize my voice on the phone, they go out of there way to ensure my comfort and needs are met. That goes a long way when I'm out of town. The last few visits, I had the opportunity to visit a few restaurants that were close by and was amazed to find a variety of national and local fare available. The central location makes it convenient to visit all the Phoenix locations that I service. All in all, I would recommend this location for business or pleasure needs as I have done both and been entirely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly decent”
Reviews.Author: chellee23
Reviews.Content: Great price, decent accommodations, awesome location; best part was that we left valuables out and they weren't touched by housekeeping!

Reviews.Title: “I hate this place - the quote on the 3rd day”
Reviews.Author: DBL_75
Reviews.Content: You know how when you're a poor starving student, you'll accept certain things - like generic macaroni & cheese; then when you're starting out you expect a little better - like brand name KD. Once you are established, its still nice to have KD, but you're much more likely to eat something else. This place is so generic Mac & cheese. We too had the police out front the first night. The rooms were not cleaned and we had to beg for towels. The first day we went to the breakfast and didn't bother going again. The choice of Rice Crispies vs Froot Loops or day old muffins; I'd rather eat at Subway. Everyone we talked to in Phoenix cringed when we told them where we were staying. I would've checked out if I would've got any money back. I won't even go into the barking dog, annoying cat, yucky pool, noisy neighbours, rude/lazy cleaning staff, etc. - Pay the extra $20 and stay somewhere else, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear”
Reviews.Author: littledogranch
Reviews.Content: I made our reservation several months ahead for a king bed, non smoking. When we drove in; our first clue should have been the police car parked in front of office. We check in. We decided to go get dinner first and then go to the room. When we finally go the room there was king size bed, but the odor of cigarettes was unbearable; and we start to look around, theres stained ashtrays everywhere, carpet was horriable, dirty, stained along with the other furniture. There's no way I would have walked on the carpet for any length of time even with cambat boots on. We went to the lobby to possible get a different room; and we were told "NO" non available. Yet theres all kind of other guests checking in; and Oh more police cars. We asked one the cops if there was problems, and her response was; "Yes, all the time". The girl at the office; (which now the lobby was closed, you had to talk to her thur a double window hole) offered to come up to the room and "spray with a flowering room spray; "it actually smells pretty good" she said. Well, if you're a non-smoker you know floral spray and stale cigarettes odor do not do well. We asked if we could get our money back; they said no since we went thru Expedia. But if we decided to leave they needed to check the room to see if it was rentable; but we could not get our money back. At this point 11pm, we decided to just take our chances and find another room elsewhere. Luckily a block or so away we stopped at Ramada; explained our problem to the manager; he gave us an amazing discount; and even offered to help us get a refund. Their room was so nice, clean, newly decorated, walk in shower, just really nice. Expedia would only refund one night; and gave us a $50 coupon. All is well as far as the money. But I would not under any circumstance recommend Days Inn Metro Center. Worst place we have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: airman20
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very comfortable, Breakfast had a good selection, awesome staff! I would have agree with the previous reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Offering up a dose of reality”
Reviews.Author: wrenweary70
Reviews.Content: My sister and I decided to book Days Inn Metro Center because of the overwhelming good reviews on here. We also booked it because it seemed like a good deal. How can you beat $32 a night? We had to move from the first room we got because the air conditioner wouldn't work properly. It shut off and never came back on. The woman down at the desk tried to tell my sister it went off at regular intervals (I thought maybe it was a "going green" sort of thing, but it had been off a LONG time!). And it's funny how the air conditioner NEVER went off on our second room. So that woman obviously lied to us. On the 2nd day, we were out of our room from 1pm-11pm. When we got in, we were surprised to see our room was never made. Nor did they ever offer us towels or anything during the duration of our stay. On the 3rd day, we were woken up by a barking dog. That same night, a group of about 8 seedy people moved in on either side of us, and they were LOUD. They stomped back and forth on the deck until 2am. They were letting their 3-year-old run around on the deck at 2am too. Talk about great parenting! On the 4th night, the noisy neighbors were still there. They were laughing and shouting, their kid was crying, their dog was barking.... and they all hung out on the balcony for HOURS doing god knows what. This went on from 5pm-12am. We finally called the front desk to tell them our neighbors were loud, and the front desk called to tell them to pipe down. Well, that made our neighbors get even louder. One guy even tried to open the adjoining door between the rooms and screamed as loud as he could. Needless to say, it was a frightening night. I know the noisy neighbors aren't the hotel's fault, but you have to consider the sort of clientele this place attracts. The next day, we'd had enough. My sister and I checked out 2 nights early. The guy at the front desk didn't care to ask why we were checking out early. If he had asked, we would have had quite a story for him! We did, however, tell the story to our cab driver on the way to our next hotel. He told us that the Days Inn was in the part of town considered the ghetto. I appreciated his honesty. Avoid this place... there are better options!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for simple needs”
Reviews.Author: xeriscaping
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel mainly for the price. Not sure if it was an "out of season" price or not, but will check on this hotel first when in need. The handicapped room is a 1 king bed room. The bathroom is quite large with a folddown shower bench that is against the wall if you don't need it or want to put another chair in there. The room has an arm chair and a desk. The decor is nice and the bed has a pretty cover and a lot of pillows. The one thing that was a shock is I had to pay for ice. 25¢, but on the other hand, it allowed me to take all I want to pay for. It is close to a lot of shopping and dining. There was some police incident both nights I was there last, which inconvenienced me because I couldn't park by my room. that was the only problem I had.

Reviews.Title: “Hot time in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: pulimom
Reviews.Content: The price was fantastic. We stayed for 3 days as we were visiting relatives. The air conditioner worked wonderful. The beds were fine. The room and bath were clean. The breakfast was good. I was disappointed I didn't make it to the pool as it looked very inviting. I booked on the internet and almost expected it to be run down (NOT), beside a truck stop or railroad track (NOT), noisy from other guests (didn't hear a thing) and the staff was very personable.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved!”
Reviews.Author: genuinetraveller_10
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at this property for over one year and I have to say...I'M IMPRESSED! The switch to Days Inn was a wonderful surprise. From the exterior paint job, the new parking lot, pool, breakfast room, new lobby, room upgrades and friendly staff certainly made my stay enjoyable. I will certainly recommend to my peers!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MA_Browne
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed here while in town for Wrestlemania. If it weren't for the fact we were splitting the cabs 4 ways it would have been expensive to get to and from the various events, but this was offset by the cheap rates at this hotel. Nothing much within walking distance other than a KMart and a Dairy Queen. Wireless internet in the hotel was patchy at best. Staff were very helpful. Rooms were adequately sized and to a satisfactory standard.

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't ask for better Inn Keepers”
Reviews.Author: odaat2001
Reviews.Content: I stay at this property in Phoenix almost every month and I could not ask for better accommodations and Linda and Barb and all the staff make my stays comfortable and worry free. They have recently done a complete renovation so you will be pleasantly surprised and pleased with your environment. Great Breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, and cheap”
Reviews.Author: joylyne
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were going to Wrestlemania this past March and needed a cheap room. We found this place for only $53 after tax. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: unleashedbaseball
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Phoenix with a youth baseball team and were looking for something reasonably priced and found this Days Inn. We had some concerns considering this hotel was just remodeled from a Motel 6 to a Days Inn. We were pleasently surprised with how comfortable this hotel was and what a great price during spring training. Linda and her staff were great and there was a lot of room for the kids to play and the moms loved the pool. Thanks again to Linda and her staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: reds05
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much for the price we paid, but it easily topped our expectations by far. I had been warned that the Metrocenter Mall area was not good, but this was a few miles north of there and the neighborhood was very nice and quiet. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the beds provided a solid night's sleep. I was surprised to find a coin-op ice machine (a first for me) but considering everything, 25 cents for a bucket of ice was no big deal. I also found a dark colored residue washing off my feet in the shower - at first I thought it was dirt, but then realized it was dark blue dye from the new carpets. Strange, but better than dirty carpets! LOL! All in all a great central location for all the ballparks, Glendale and downtown stadium areas. Right off 17 and easy access to the airport. Unless you are looking for 5 star luxury accomodations, you won't be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and an exceptional value.”
Reviews.Author: SnakeBellevue
Reviews.Content: For a motel in North Central Phoenix......during Spring Training......you would not expect much for $50 a night, Wow.....it was clean, comfortable, and with one exception, the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were well done with tasteful decorations, and comfotable furniture........even an easy chair. I have stayed all over the valley and the Days Inn Metro Center is the best value I have encountered.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Baseball_Mom1121
Reviews.Content: Beds were comfortable. Showers drain very slowly. Breakfast in the morning was crowded and the selection was not that great. We ended up going off site for breakfast. You have to pay for ice....better to go around the corner to Circle K to buy it. Overall the hotel was fine for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Twin60az
Reviews.Content: No tub stopper, could only take showers. Room stunk, smelled like smoke and old socks. Supposed to be a non-smoking room. Charged for ice from the ice machine (1st placed I ever stayed that did this???) Toilet backed up all over the room just after we arrived (just peed that’s all , I swear). Carpet was very dirty (never took our socks off (bottom of our socks got black from the dirt). Very rude night attendant! Worst of all the date of our arrival got screwed up and they insisted on charging us a no show fee for the previous night (for an obvious mistake). Stay clear of this place. If all Days Inn's are like this then I'll pay a little more to stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Big Difference, now and before. Great Job....”
Reviews.Author: junoJuno_Usa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 8 months ago, formaly known as Motel 6, now Days Inn. Well job done. As a Motel 6 it was not so great experience, The staff were great and accommodating. The complimentary breakfast saved us time and money every morning. We were close enough to everything we needed, but far enough away from the hustle bustle of fall move in. The room was very clean and comfortable, nice pillow top beds.I plan to stay there every time I go to visit, and I highly recommend this hotel if you plan to stay in this are. If you stayed here in past, you will see the big difference....

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Honest Staff, Clean, and Breakfast too !”
Reviews.Author: funincancun
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and 4 nites in mid Feb. The room was spactious, clean, with a firm bed and perfect for us. We left a jacket with a new cell phone in it at breakfast one morning and didn't get back to the hotel until mid afternoon and the staff had secured the jacket and phone for us and had it waiting for us at the desk; we can't tell you what a relief that was to have this wonderful staff take care of us like that and not have us deal with replacing a new cell phone and jacket. Thank you , Thank you, Thank you !!!!!!!!!!!!! The pool was great, the breakfast was perfect, coffee too, and all at a great price. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PeachPatchArizona
Reviews.Content: This motel is completely BRAND new (well, it's a brand new rennovation). The king size bed had a pillow-top mattress & was quite comfortable. There was a down comforter & duvet on the bed! Great pillows too. All the furnishings in the room were brand new, attractive & well suited to the room. The bathroom was new & clean. The shower was great & the shower curtain new & spotlessly clean. On the down side, this is not the greatest neighborhood. It's not ghetto, but it's certainly not nice. It's located along the freeway frontage road, and you can hear some road noise. Probably not as bad on the back side of the motel (we faced the freeway). The noise was not enough to distract from a GOOD night's sleep. For the price, this motel was out of this world good. My only advice to the new owners would be to include a hair dryer in the room (there was none).

Reviews.Title: “New "Days Inn" great place to stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: fasaav81
Reviews.Content: My experience staying in this hotel was the best , the value was great. the staff was very helpful and pleasant with all of us. Since it was really affordable i had no expectations, but for my surprise and delight it was a clean peaceful place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Motel 6 but a lot quieter than others”
Reviews.Author: sururohit
Reviews.Content: The new owners have done a good job keeping this place quite, the rates are the cheapest of all Motel 6's since it now a franchise owned property and not corporate. The rooms are bigger than most motel 6's ive stayed in and cleanest!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Motel 666”
Reviews.Author: ETtracker
Reviews.Content: On July 15, 2009, I checked into th Sweetwater Motel 6 for an expected 6 days. Over the past 10 years, I've stayed there dozens of times, but this time was different. they had new staff and management. The lady clerk was not very friendly and the manager looked and dressed like a biker chick from the 1960s. The box spring part of my bed was noisy and full of tears and holes. On my 3rd day there, my son came to see me at about noon. An hour earlier, I was paying for that night and mentioned to the clerk that I was excited that my son was coming to see. The clerk said that I would have to pay for a 2nd person. I laughed and said that he had to be back home by 1:30 and that he was not a guest. She said it did'nt matter and I would still+ have to pay. When I realized that she was serious, I told her that I would make other arrangements to visit with my son. When my son arrived, we took a short driveto say hello, and I dropped him off at the bus stop. The following morning, I went to pay my last days rent, when the clerk told me that I could not stay another night. I asked her why and she said she would call the manager. She returned and said that her manager said that I would have to check out. When I asked why, she said that she wasn't sure, but it might have somethimng to do with my son coming over the bday before. It was 110 degrees out and I had 15 minutes to be out of my room. I had to go find another room which took me about 2 hours. I have never in my life been treated so rudely or unjustly by any hotel or motel. Motel 6 is a national chain that used to care about their guests, but that is clearly no longer the case.

Reviews.Title: “Just want a bed and a shower? you got it.”
Reviews.Author: Amylgam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night. The neighborhood is a little sketchy--the razor wire fence around the hotel parking lot and the lack of good lighting did not give me a comfortable feeling. The television did not work at all. When i called the front desk to tell them they said I could change rooms, but that they didn't have any non-smoking rooms available. I'm guessing they just didn't have that many working TV's! The room was clean and in acceptable condition, but there really wasn't anything outstanding here. If you're just on the road and looking to sleep and shower it will do you OK, just make sure you lock your car.

Reviews.Title: “Should be rented by the hour!!! DUMP!!”
Reviews.Author: CourtBro
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what hotel the previous reviewer stayed in but it was obviously not this hotel. First, the Motel 6 website shows pictures of a beautiful brand new hotel with inside rooms. When I arrived it was a run down 30 year plus Motel. The place was FILTHY!! and the neighborhood was sketchy with razar barbed wire surrounding the neighboring building. The room smelled and the carpet was frayed around the door. The sheets were thread bare and I was afraid to sleep on them anyway because they did not look clean. The A/C worked but was covered with dust or mold, I did not want to inspect any closer than needed. The shower overflowed because the drain in the tub did not work. I tried to clean the overflow of water by blotting the carpet with the motel's white towels, they were stained brown once I was done. So needless to say the floor was far from clean. The rest of the carpet looked as if it hadn't been cleaned in years. Now that I'm done venting, I would STRONGLY advise you not to stay here. I checked the address several times to make sure I was in the correct place. The website pictures are wrong and this place should be rented by the hour!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Motel Six Sweetwater, Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: aboveparspringfield
Reviews.Content: GREAT Motel Six - Sweetwater, Phoenix, AZ Date: May 8, 2007 Reviewer- J. Greene - Springfield, OR this was without doubt, overall, the best motel 6 i've stayed in. the staff were wonderful, particularly sara. the window on our car wouldn't roll up and at night they watched it for us. the offrice staff was friendly and helpful. it was the quietest room i've ever stayed in. my only suggestion is that they need to vacuum the room better and make sure they look under the edge of the bed as i found a previous occupant's sock.
